top_categories.workout_context: 150 miles. Your legs will beg to quit after 120. This trains the power output you need from mile 130 onward.
Gravel Worlds Amateur's Nebraska rolling farmland gravel rewards steady threshold power. Surging and recovering costs more watts than just holding.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Gravel Worlds Amateur's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before August.
Gravel Worlds Amateur's Nebraska farmland, Rolling gravel forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 150 miles.
Every hard session works better with a bigger aerobic base. At 150 miles, base fitness is the difference between racing and surviving.
150 miles rewards fat oxidation. This volume work shifts your fuel mix so you're still burning fat at hour 5, not bonking at hour 3.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Gravel Worlds Amateur. Train it until it feels boring.
At Gravel Worlds Amateur, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
When someone attacks on Nebraska rolling farmland gravel, you have 10 seconds to respond or you're off the back. This builds that response.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 3,500ft of climbing on Nebraska rolling farmland gravel does to your power file on race day.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Gravel Worlds Amateur, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Tempo is Gravel Worlds Amateur's race pace. The wattage you'll hold for 150 miles on Nebraska rolling farmland gravel. Train it until it's automatic.

race_overlay.nutrition: Ultra-distance fueling for 150 miles: 80–100g carbs/hour from mile 1 — don’t wait until you’re hungry. Practice your exact race-day nutrition in every long training ride. Carry backup calories. 150 miles burns 8,000–12,000+ calories — you cannot replace them all, but you must try.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Gravel Worlds Amateur requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on nebraska rolling farmland gravel to build confidence. Expect: nebraska farmland, rolling gravel, 150-mile distance.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, TT Threshold, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 150 miles of nebraska rolling farmland gravel in Lincoln, Nebraska.
